perturbation.original_text:
6.7. Interest. All payments not paid by the date such payments are due shall
bear interest from the due date to the date payments are actually paid at the
lower of (a) 1% per month or (b) the maximum rate permitted by law.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.7. Interest. All payments not paid by the date such payments are due shall
bear interest from the due date to the date payments are actually paid at a
fixed rate of 10% per annum. This rate shall apply regardless of any legal
maximums, and no other interest rates will be considered.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a direct contradiction regarding the interest rate applied to late payments. The original clause allows for a variable interest rate, capped by legal limits. The modification establishes a fixed 10% annual rate without considering legal limitations, creating uncertainty about which interest rate should be applied and raising concerns about legal compliance.

perturbation.original_text:
6.6.  Audits.  During the 12 month period following the payment of any
amount due under this Article 6, VerticalNet or its representative shall have
the right to audit LeadersOnline's financial and other pertinent records
relating to such payment in order to verify the amount of the payments owed
and/or paid.  If the amount owed by LeadersOnline to VerticalNet was underpaid,
the additional amount owed shall be paid to VerticalNet within 15 days of notice
of such underpayment to LeadersOnline.  If the amount owed by LeadersOnline to
VerticalNet was underpaid in excess of 10% of the amount owed, the fees of such
audit shall also be paid to VerticalNet within 15 days of notice of such to
LeadersOnline.  If the amount owed by LeadersOnline to
perturbation.changed_text: 6.6.  Audits. VerticalNet shall have the right to audit LeadersOnline's records, but only after providing a 60-day written notice. Audits can only be performed once per calendar year. If an underpayment is discovered, LeadersOnline will have 60 days to remit the outstanding balance. If an overpayment is discovered, VerticalNet must reimburse LeadersOnline within 30 days. However, if LeadersOnline disputes the findings of the audit, the payment terms are immediately suspended until the dispute is resolved through arbitration, regardless of the outcome.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces several inconsistencies regarding the audit process. The original clause allows for audits within 12 months of payment, whereas the modified clause requires a 60-day notice. It also specifies conditions of dispute resolution in which the payments can be suspended regardless of outcome and it contradicts with Article 8 of Dispute Resolution.

perturbation.original_text:
7.1. Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written
notice to the other Party in the event of any material breach of a term of this
Agreement by such other Party that remains uncured 30 days after notice of such
breach was received by such other Party or, if the breach is not reasonably
capable of cure within 30 days, such longer period, not to exceed 60 days, so
long as the cure is commenced within the 30-day period and thereafter is
diligently prosecuted to completion as soon as possible and in any event within
60 days.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1.  Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon providing verbal notice to the other Party in the event of any material breach of a term of this Agreement by such other Party. Cure periods will not apply, and the termination will be effective immediately upon providing such verbal notice. However, a written confirmation is still required, but the date on such written confirmation does not affect the termination date.
perturbation.explanation: The changed text now contradicts the original agreement by allowing immediate termination with verbal notice, removing the cure period, which is a material breach condition of 30-60 days. This creates ambiguity about the proper procedure for termination and whether the other party is entitled to cure the breach.
